gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ThreeD
Class SelectedListItem

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ThreeD.SelectedListItem

public class SelectedListItem
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to convert one form of selected list items to another form. A selected list item has two parts: the detector IDs and the pixel IDs. It assumed that for each detector id, all of the given pixel ids are "selected" for that detector. Thus, all detectors in the item share the same selected pixels. The ids may be create or retrieved as an array of integers or as Strings. The format for the String is that of the object IntList. IntList is used to convert the String format into an array format and vice versa.

See Also:
IntList

Constructor Detail

SelectedListItem

public SelectedListItem(java.lang.String det_string,
                        java.lang.String pix_string)
Constructor. Take in two strings representing the detector ids and their selected pixel ids. The strings should be in a format as described by the object IntList.

Parameters:
det_string - String containing the formatted collection of detector IDs.
pix_string - String containing the formatted collection of pixel IDs.
See Also:
IntList

SelectedListItem

public SelectedListItem(int[] det_array,
                        int[] pix_array)
Constructor. Take in two arrays representing the detector ids and their selected pixel ids. The ids in each array should be sorted in increasing order.

Parameters:
det_array - Array containing the integer of detector IDs.
pix_array - Array containing the integer of pixel IDs.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The string repesentation of the SelectedListItem. It formats it as follows: "Det Pix " Where det_string and pix_string contain the detector and pixel IDs, repsectively, in the format specified by IntList.
